title: Physical computation and compositionality. (arXiv:2210.00392v3 [quant-ph] UPDATED)
abstract: Developments in quantum computing and, more in general, non-standard computing systems, represent a clear indication that the very notion of what a physical computing device is and does should be recast in a rigorous and sound framework. Physical computing has opened a whole stream of new research aimed to understand and control how information is processed by several types of physical devices. Therefore, classical definitions and entire frameworks need to be adapted in order to fit a broader notion of what physical computing systems really are. Recent studies have proposed a formalism that can be used to carve out a more proper notion of physical computing. translated_abstract: 量子计算和非标准计算系统的发展表明，对物理计算设备定义和作用的概念应该在一个严谨而有力的框架中重新定义。物理计算已经开辟了大量研究，旨在理解和控制通过多种物理设备处理信息的方式。因此，需要调整经典定义和整个框架，以适应更广泛的物理计算系统的概念。最近的研究提出了一种形式主义，可以用来刻画更恰当的物理计算概念。在本文中，我们提出了一个基于范畴论基本结构自然地捕捉这些结果的框架。此外，我们展示了在我们的框架中，物理计算系统的组合性质是自然形式化的，并且可以通过范畴论构造来组织成一致的结构。
tldr: 本文提出了一个基于范畴论基本结构的框架，自然地捕捉到一种更适当的物理计算概念，并表明物理计算系统的组合性质是自然形式化的。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a framework based on basic constructions in Category Theory to capture a more proper notion of physical computing, and shows that the compositional nature of physical computing systems is naturally formalized within this framework.
